verses.verse: {A psalm by the descendants of Korah. A song.} {The Holy City for All People} d God's {Lit. His} foundation is in the holy mountains.
The Lord loves the gates of Zion more than the dwellings of Jacob.
Glorious things are spoken about you, city of God. (Interlude)
I will mention Rahab and Babylon among those who acknowledge me including Philistia, Tyre, and Ethiopia {Lit. Cush} "This one was born there,"they say. {The Heb. lacks they say}
Indeed, about Zion it will be said: "More than one person {Lit. a man and a man} was born in it,"and "The Most High himself did {Or secured} it."
The Lord will record, as he registers the peoples, {Lit. record, in a registry of people} "This one was born there." Interlude
Then singers, as they play their instruments, {Or singers and flute players} will declare, "All my roots {Lit. springs} are in you."
